ej,gonza003,P,drakr901,Called third strike ej,blacb001,M,drakr901,Called third strike $Padres first baseman Adrian Gonzalez objected to the call third strike; he kept arguing and was ejected by HP umpire Rob Drake; Padres manager Buddy Black came and got between Gonzalez and Drake; crew chief Joe West escorted Gonzalez back to the dugout while Gonzalez still chirped about the call; Black kept pointing at the plate and was ejected by Drake

Protest=V

$Padres pitcher Clayton Richard was not listed on the lineup card submitted to the umpires before the game; Adam Russell, who had been sent to the minors earlier in the day, was listed as the pitcher; citing the rule that states that the pitcher on the lineup card must face one batter, the Nationals protested the game; Padres manager Bud Black told the umpires about the issue and the umpires told Nationals manager Jim Riggleman, who filed the protest because Russell was not in the game; the Nationals won the game and dropped their protest
Ted Simmons managed game for Padres while Bud Black was away
$Gutierrez missed diving try and ball rolled to fence
$a 5.7-magnitude earthquake shook the ballpark and the RF pole swayed

$Cesar Izturis called out for interfering with catcher Yorvit Torrealba who was trying to throw to 3B on an attempted steal; Izturis leaned back from the plate and the ball went into LF; HP umpire Chris Guccione made the call

ej,hairs001,P,kulpr901,Called third strike $Padres left fielder Scott Hairston flipped his bat onto the plate after the third strike; as he bent over to pick it up, HP umpire Ron Kulpa saw the bat on the ground and said something to Hairston, who responded; Hairston was ejected by Kulpa

ej,rentr001,C,danlk901,Balk call not made $Padres First Base Coach Rich Renteria argued with 1B umpire Kerwin Danley that the move to 1B by Rodrigo Lopez was a balk; Danley told him to do his job and, when Renteria continued the argument, Danley ejected Renteria
$DBacks LF Rusty Ryal made a diving attempt at the ball down the line

ej,cabre001,P,demud901,Kicking Mark Reynolds during tag play $DBacks third baseman Mark Reynolds made a diving tag on Everth Cabrera and his momentum caused him to roll over on top of Cabrera; Cabrera kicked at Reynolds trying to get him off; Reynolds came back at Cabrera and the stood up; 3B umpire Dana DeMuth got between them and pushed Cabrera away; both benches and bullpens emptied; Cabrera was ejected by DeMuth
